![Baengnyongdonggul Cave-Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (Î∞±Î£°ÎèôÍµ¥-Í∞ïÏõêÍ≥†ÏÉùÎåÄ Íµ≠Í∞ÄÏßÄÏßàÍ≥µÏõê)](/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353727_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Baengnyongdonggul Cave is a 1.8„éû-long, natural limestone cave located in Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do. The cave entrance is located 10-15„éû above sea level, and is surrounded by rocks. In 1976, local residents expanded a small lane in the middle of the main cave corridor to allow for easier exploration. Since then, the cave has continued to be explored and researched with great value for geologists. The cave was designated Natural Monument No. 260 in 1979. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-560-2379| |parking:|Available (Small vehicles 67 parking spaces / Large vehicles 6 parking spaces)| |restdate:|Monday (Tuesday if a holiday falls on Monday), January 1, the day of Seollal (Lunar New Year's Day) & Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving) holidays| |usetime:|* Cave exploration: 09:00-15:00
* Visitors must arrive at least 20 minutes before departure
* Scheduled tours departing 14:40 & 15:00 will not be in operation during winter| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Available Facilities:|Management office, parking lot, rest plaza, etc| |Facility Utilization Fees:|Adults - Individuals 15,000 won / Groups 10,000 won
Children & Teenagers - Individuals 10,000 won / Groups 7,000 won

* Groups: 20 people or more| |Restrooms:|Available| |Reservation Info. for Natives:|On-site ticket sales: 1st (09:00), 2nd (09:30), 11th (14:00), 12th (15:00) tours

Online reservations: 3rd-7th (10:00, 10:30, 11:00, 11:30, 12:30) tours
* Total of 20 tickets sold per tour

Package tours: 8th-10th (13:00, 13:20, 13:40) tours
* Tickets can be purchased through the Maha-ri Eoreumchi Vilalge website only.| ## Detail Image ![/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353727_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353727_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353729_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353729_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353730_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353730_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353732_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-21-1666338656222/2353732_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-560-2379](tel:+82335602379) - [üè†www.paleozoicgp.com](http://www.paleozoicgp.com/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.2779144274 longitude: 128.5770904015 title: 63, Munhui-gil, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take a bus to Pyeongchang Bus Terminal.
From Pyeongchang Bus Terminal Bus Stop, take a local bus bound for Baeknyong Cave and get off at Baeknyong Cave Bus Stop.

data.title: Baengnyongdonggul Cave-Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (Î∞±Î£°ÎèôÍµ¥-Í∞ïÏõêÍ≥†ÏÉùÎåÄ Íµ≠Í∞ÄÏßÄÏßàÍ≥µÏõê)
data.description: Baengnyongdonggul Cave is a 1.8„éû-long, natural limestone cave located in Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do. The cave entrance is located 10-15„éû above sea level, and is surrounded by rocks. In 1976, local residents expanded a small lane in the middle of the main cave corridor to allow for easier exploration. Since then, the cave has continued to be explored and researched with great value for geologists. The cave was designated Natural Monument No. 260 in 1979.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangneung Coffee Street (Í∞ïÎ¶âÏª§ÌîºÍ±∞Î¶¨)
dataList.description: Gangneung in Gangwon-do is the first local district in Korea to host a coffee festival and support coffee artisans as well as promote development of coffee related facilities and contents such as a coffee museum, coffee street, coffee factory, barista academy, and more. With almost all coffee shops in the area roasting their own coffee beans, Gangneung is well-recognized as the city of coffee.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangmun Beach (Í∞ïÎ¨∏Ìï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description: Located in Gangmun-dong, Gangmun Beach is lined with fresh hoe (sliced raw fish) restaurants along Gangmunhang Port. The beach has accommodations nearby and is in close proximity to the Gyeongpo area, making it a great vacation destination. Not only is the beach a well-known diving spot among scuba divers for its deep waters and abundant marine life, but its dock is also popular among fishers all year round.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm (ÎåÄÍ¥ÄÎ†π ÏÇºÏñëÎ™©Ïû•)
dataList.description: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm is a livestock farm opened in 1972 to source product for Samyang Food, then opened as a tourist attraction in 2007 making it open to the public. The animals are free to roam the large ranch fields and the wind generator on top of the hill is the largest in Korea to create natural energy. At the farm, visitors can take in the beautiful scenery, watch a sheep herding performance, feed sheep and ostrich, and so much more. There are various Samyang products sold at the ranch mart as well as organic milk products to try as well.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Oksanga - Okgwangsan Jade Mine (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Ïò•ÏÇ∞Í∞Ä (Ïò•Í¥ëÏÇ∞))
dataList.description: This tourist destination was established as a healing and experience attraction based on Korea‚Äôs only jade mine in Chuncheon. It comprises Jade Cave Experience Center, Jade Mine Sauna, Toy Museum, Bakery Cafe, restaurant, and other facilities. In particular, Jade Cave Experience Center, which was built by using an actual jade pit, invites visitors to observe and touch rough gemstones. The center has a shelter surrounded by jade stones and an earthenware museum, which exhibits various types of earthenware. If you want to have a healing experience with jade‚Äôs energy, the jade sauna is an ideal place to visit. The sauna was built with high-quality nephrite from the jade mine and uses mineral water produced from deep in the jade pit. Moon Valley consisting of a gallery, modern history museum, and toy museum is popular among family visitors with children, and kidults too. The toy museum is full of famous character figures from animated films and popular movies, such as Taekwon V, Mazinger Z, Disney characters, and Star Wars characters. The outdoor park behind the Moon Valley has a small zoo and a walking path.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Mulgil-ro (Ï∂òÏ≤úÎ¨ºÎ†àÍ∏∏)
dataList.description: The Mullegil Trail is designed to guide tourists to enjoy the beautiful scenery along the waterway in Chuncheon, a lake city. The Mullegil Trail also offers tourists an opportunity to travel around Chuncheon‚Äôs lake and river by canoe. With basic instructions, people of all ages can go canoeing easily. Many companies provide diverse canoeing courses, and their common course starts from the Chuncheon Songam Sports Town, continues to canoe toward the Uiamho Lake Skywalk, and returns. Tourists can enjoy canoeing along the Chuncheon Mullegil Trail and use the King Canoe Quay, which is equipped with a facility for the vulnerable people on tourism. Selected as an open tourist attraction, the King Canoe Quay provides canoeing programs for people in wheelchairs and the visually impaired.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Cheongpyeongsa Temple (Ï≤≠ÌèâÏÇ¨ (Ï∂òÏ≤ú))
dataList.description: Cheongpyeongsa Temple is a Buddhist temple with 1,000 years of tradition, located at Obongsan Mountain. Originally established as Baegamseonwon Temple in 973, the temple changed its name several times, went through construction works, and has become the current Cheongpyeongsa Temple. Yi Ja-hyeon, a scholar of the Goryeo period, built a garden here by keeping its natural topography after he left his government post. In this area, there is a pond that was built during the Goryeo period and has preserved its original form. Many cultural heritages have disappeared over the years and during the Korean War as well. The remaining cultural heritages include Hoejeonmun Gate of Cheongpyeongsa Temple (Treasure No. 164), Three-story Stone Pagoda of Cheongpyeongsa Temple (Gangwon-do Cultural Heritage Material No. 8), and Stupa of Yi Ja-hyeon (posthumous epithet  Jillakgong). Cheongpyeongsa Temple‚Äôs Hoejeonmun Gate was built instead of Sacheonwangmun Gate (the gate of the Four Guardian Kings), in order to enlighten people about the transmigration of souls. Cheongpyeongsa Temple bears a myth about a princess and a serpent. The princess suffered a lot from a serpent as she couldn‚Äôt get rid of it from her body. Then she came to Cheongpyeongsa Temple and prayed to the Buddha, and she became free from the serpent. Therefore, the Three-story Stone Pagoda of Cheongpyeongsa Temple is also called ‚ÄúPrincess Pagoda.‚Äù Although the scale of the temple is not large, it is known for beautiful natural landscape harmonized with artificial structures, such as a pavilion and a pond. Accordingly, the area of the temple was designated as Scenic Site No. 70. Cheongpyeongsa Temple can be also reached by taking a ferry at the Soyanggang Dam Quay.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuam Suspension Bridge (Ï∂îÏïî Ï∂úÎ†ÅÎã§Î¶¨)
dataList.description: Chuam Suspension Bridge is located near Chotdae Rock, famous as a sunrise spot. The 72 meters long suspension bridge is the first suspension bridge that crosses over the ocean in Korea.
dataList.author: korea-tour
